intro: Halimium halimifolium subsp. multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its fleshy, hairy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
